content.description:
Start about six feet left of the

Narcissus

off-width at an arête. Climb the grainy face between the two obvious cracks to the top. The crux is at the bottom.
content.protection: TR. With a few medium cams, you can build an anchor.
content.location:
Start about six feet left of the

Narcissus

off-width at an arête.

content.description:
Begin about six feet left of

Unrequited Love

at the left-hand crack on the formation. The bottom of this crack overhangs and quickly goes from hands to fists. Struggle past the initial bulge to a stance, then climb the easier wide crack above to the top. This bottom of this climb is likely harder than 10- if you have small hands.
content.protection: Bring several fist and bigger sized cams. With a few medium sized cams you can make an anchor.
content.location:
Begin about six feet left of

Unrequited Love

at the left-hand crack on the formation.

To descend from the summit of the formation, you'll either need to do a Needles rappel or downclimb a varnished chimney on the rear of the formation (5.3).

content.description: The Nymph Node has two obvious wide cracks that are sunny and face the road. This is the right-hand crack, a off-width. The crux is at the bottom and likely is quite a bit harder if you are short.
content.protection: To adequately protect this route you need cams larger than a green Black Diamond Camalot or Big Bros. With a few medium cams, you can build an anchor to TR the route.
content.location:
This formation is about 50 feet right (E) of the Reverberation Rocks parking spot and 75 feet from (N) the road. This is the right of two cracks - an off-width.

To descend from the summit of the formation, you'll either need to do a Needles rappel or downclimb a varnished chimney on the rear of the formation (5.3).

content.description: On the back (N) side of The Nymph Node is a pretty, varnished chimney. This route may be climbed to set up a TR on the routes on the south (roadside) face, or used as the descent route for the formation.
content.protection: On the far interior (south) side of the chimney are finger sized cracks that could be used for protection.
content.location:
On the back (N) side of The Nymph Node is a pretty, varnished chimney.

Either downclimb this route or do a Needles rappel to get off the formation.
